head.title: Pacers Beat Knicks To Take a 3-2 Lead

hedline.hl1: Pacers Beat Knicks To Take a 3-2 Lead

block.p: The Indiana Pacers used a 23-3 run in the second quarter to wrest control of Game 5 from the Knicks and take an 88-79 victory last night in Indianapolis.

The Pacers lead the four-of-seven-game Eastern Conference finals by three games to two. Indiana can make its first trip to the National Basketball Association finals with a victory tomorrow night at Madison Square Garden or in Game 7 on Sunday.
The Indiana Pacers used a 23-3 run in the second quarter to wrest control of Game 5 from the Knicks and take an 88-79 victory last night in Indianapolis.

The Pacers lead the four-of-seven-game Eastern Conference finals by three games to two. Indiana can make its first trip to the National Basketball Association finals with a victory tomorrow night at Madison Square Garden or in Game 7 on Sunday.
Travis Best led Indiana with 24 points.

With Patrick Ewing in the lineup despite a foot injury, the Knicks dominated the game at the beginning and extended their lead to 37-19 in the second quarter. But the Knicks finished the last 10 minutes 42 seconds of the half making only 1 of their 15 shots and finished with 8 points for the quarter. The Pacers took advantage and rallied for a 42-40 lead at halftime. SportsThursday, Page D1.
